### Shuttle Service Tender Announcement

#### Contract Details

*   **Reference Number**: cb-446-17625849
*   **Amendment Number**: 5
*   **Solicitation Number**: 21120-24-4504346
*   **Publication Date**: 2023-12-21
*   **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-01-08T14:00:00
*   **Contracting Entity**: Correctional Service Canada (CSC)
*   **Address**: 340 Laurier Ave W, Ottawa, Ontario K2B 6Z8
*   **Contact Information**:
    *   Diana Todorova
    *   (343) 552-1625
    *   diana.todorova@csc-scc.gc.ca

#### Tender Description

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the provision of shuttle services for recruits participating in the Correctional Training Program (CTP) at the National Training Academy (NTA) in Kingston, Ontario.

#### Objective

The CSC requires a reliable and efficient shuttle service to transport recruits from the NTA to various firearms ranges and back to the NTA. The service must be available on an as-needed basis, with specific requirements outlined in the Request for Proposal (RFP).

#### Key Requirements

*   Round-trip shuttle service for up to 32 CTP recruits from the NTA to various firearms ranges in the Kingston area
*   Morning and evening shuttle services on training days
*   Shuttle service on CTP graduation days for the Graduation Dinner

#### Term of Contract

The proposed contract is for a period of one (1) year, with the option to renew for two (2) additional years.

#### Evaluation Criteria

Tenders will be evaluated based on the Lowest Price compliant bid.

#### Language of Bid

Bidders may submit their bid in either English or French.

#### Payment

The contract will be paid in accordance with the payment terms outlined in the RFP.

#### Notes for Respondents

*   Suppliers interested in bidding on this opportunity can register on the Canada Buys website (https://canadabuys.cansa Gov/) and download the RFP documents.
*   The CSC reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
*   After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

#### Additional Information
